Mariana Dyakova is a consultant in public health and deputy director for Policy, Research and International Development in Public Health Wales and an honorary clinical lecturer at the University of Warwick, UK. Her interests include: evidence translation, implementation and communication into policy and practice; sustainable development and health; international health policy; and chronic disease prevention. Originally from Bulgaria, Mariana gained her academic, policy and practical experience across Europe. She was actively involved into public health capacity building in South Eastern Europe and a number of European health projects. Over the last six years, Mariana has been working across Public Health England, the National Health Service (NHS) and local government in the UK. She also took a position as technical officer for policy and governance for health and wellbeing in the World Health Organization (WHO) Regional Office for Europe (2013/14). Presently she is a ‘national health policies’ consultant for WHO and actively engaged in the WHO Regions for Health Network and EuroHealthNet. Leading the International Health Coordination Centre in Wales allows her to work closely with Welsh Government and the Department of Health in the UK.




(last updated 20.09.2016)

Dr Hans Kluge is a Belgian trained medical doctor holding a Diploma degree in public health. Previously based in the WHO Country Office in Myanmar and the WHO Director-General’s Special Representative Office in Russia, he has a wealth of country and management experience spanning several WHO Regions with a background in health systems, public health and infectious diseases, including in Somalia, Liberia, Myanmar, Russia, Siberia (prisons), Central Asia and Caucasus.

Dr Kluge moved to the WHO Regional Office in Copenhagen in 2009 when he was recruited to the position of Unit Head, Country Policies and Systems and has since worked as the Regional Director’s Special Representative to Combat M/XDR-TB in the European Region. In 2010, he became the Director, Division of Health Systems and Public Health.

He received the Award from the Russian government for his efforts in combating TB and TB/HIV in the Russian penitentiary system.

He is Associate Editor, International Journal of Integrated Care and published in the field of TB and MDR-TB, health systems and public health (including on the impact of the economic crisis on health and health system performance in Europe).

(last updated 17.09.2015)
